result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jon Appleyard

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 8, 2022 at 02:50 pm.
Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- B.R.

$1,000 signature bond with the first $100 in cash.  No contact with victim(s):  B.J.R.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Defendant to reside with mother at 709 Humboldt Ave, Wausau, WI 54403.  Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence -- Wausau Police Department.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Case Called: 2:00 p.m.

State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears in custody from the MCJ via Zoom video, with Attorney Vanessa Avila.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

- To reside with Mother: 709 Humboldt Ave, Wausau, WI 54403.
